item.title: Need help with ::master!
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

code=java {
for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
c.playerLevel = 99;
c.playerXP = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
}

}

}[/code]
Try and see if that works… I took the public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) out so nondonators can use it and made it so it doesn’t do all 22 skills, it only goes to 6 (Attack - Magic) Tell me results. xD

Read full topic

@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“chrisrocks4122, post:1, topic:450065”]I want to make ::master for everyone but I only want the skills to be 99 for combat skills. And I don’t want it for donors only!
Can anyone help me please?

(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”)) {
for (int i = 0; i < 22; i++) {
c.playerLevel[i] = 99;
c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
}

}

public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)
{

}
}[/quote]

item.description:
@chrisrocks4122 wrote:

I want to make ::master for everyone but I only want the skills to be 99 for combat skills. And I don’t want it for donors only!
Can anyone help me please?

(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”)) {
for (int i = 0; i < 22; i++) {
c.playerLevel[i] = 99;
c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
}

}

public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)
{
